intro: Scabiosa portae, commonly known as the common scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn. Scabiosa portae is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also a source of nectar for pollinators.
